|A1|\displaystyle|A_{1}| ≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​X)4​𝟏{vn≤|Δi​X|≤vn​(1+vnη)}]12​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}X)^{4}\mathbf{1}_{\{v_{n}\leq|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\}}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(Δn​vn4−Y​vnη)12​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12.\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{4-Y}v_{n}^{\eta}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}. (103)

Since MM is square integrable, it yields ∑i=1n(Δi​M)2=OP​(1)\sum_{i=1}^{n}(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}=O_{P}(1). Then we find:

∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12≤\displaystyle\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\leq (∑i=1nKmn​Δn2​(ti−1−τ))1/2​(∑i=1n(Δi​M)2)1/2\displaystyle\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}K^{2}_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\Big)^{1/2}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\Big)^{1/2}
≲\displaystyle\lesssim 1mn​Δn.\displaystyle\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}. (104)

Along with mn≪Δn−1m_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{-1} and the boundedness of KK, we conclude that

|A1|≲1Δn1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn1/2​vn2−Y/2​vnη2=vnη2=oP​(1).|A_{1}|\lesssim\frac{1}{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}v_{n}^{\frac{\eta}{2}}=v_{n}^{\frac{\eta}{2}}=o_{P}(1).

A similar argument shows that A2=oP​(1)A_{2}=o_{P}(1). ♢\diamondsuit

Proof of (38).

For convenience, we rewrite (38) here:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​X)2​fn​(Δi​X)​Δi​M]=oP​(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (105)

The proof follows along the lines of the proof of an analogous identity in [3] (see Lemma 7 and Eq. (D.10) in the supplemental material of [4] posted online). More specifically, it was proved there in that

1vn2−Y/2​∑i=1n𝔼i−1​[(Δi​X)2​fn​(Δi​X)​Δi​M]=oP​(1).\displaystyle\frac{1}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (106)

Note that (105) does not directly follow from (106) and the boundedness of KK because mn​Δn→0m_{n}\Delta_{n}\to{}0. So, we need to account for the localizing effect of the kernel, for which we applied some different bounds.

Using the notation introduced in (A), consider the decomposition

(Δi​X)2=(xi+εi)2=xi2+2​xi​εi+εi2.(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}=(x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i})^{2}=x_{i}^{2}+2x_{i}\varepsilon_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}^{2}.

We begin by analyzing the second and third terms on the right-hand side by Cauchy-Schwarz. In particular, applying (57), we obtain that

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[εi2​fn​(Δi​X)​|Δi​M|]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\varepsilon_{i}^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)|\Delta_{i}M|\right]
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[εi4]12​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\varepsilon_{i}^{4}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn32​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12=oP​(1),\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}=o_{P}(1),

since, by (A.3), ∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12≲1mn​Δn\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\lesssim\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}} and, recalling that vn≫Δn1/2v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{1/2},

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn3/2​1mn​Δn=Δn​vnY/2−2≪ΔnY/4≪1.\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{3/2}\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}=\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{Y/2-2}\ll\Delta_{n}^{Y/4}\ll 1.

For the term involving xi​εix_{i}\varepsilon_{i}, note that when |εi|>vn|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}, by Lemma 3 in [4], for some constant K>0K>0, we have

Pi−1​(|εi|>vn)≤𝔼i−1​[|εi|r]vnr≤K​Δn1+r​(12−β),\displaystyle P_{i-1}(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n})\leq\frac{\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[|\varepsilon_{i}|^{r}]}{v_{n}^{r}}\leq K\Delta_{n}^{1+r\left(\frac{1}{2}-\beta\right)}, (107)

which holds for sufficiently large rr due to (57) and vn≫Δnβv_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta}. Similar to (A.2), using Hölder’s inequality and Proposition 1, we conclude that:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[|εi​xi|​𝟏{|xi|≤C​vn}​|Δi​M|​𝟏{|εi|>vn}]=oP​(1).\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\varepsilon_{i}x_{i}|\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}\}}\right]=o_{P}(1).

When |εi|≤vn|\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}, observe that |Δi​X|≤ζ​vn|\Delta_{i}X|\leq\zeta v_{n} implies |xi|=|ΔiX−εi|≤(1+ζ)vn=:Cvn|x_{i}|=|\Delta_{i}X-\varepsilon_{i}|\leq(1+\zeta)v_{n}=:Cv_{n}. Then, by Proposition 3 in [4], (57), and (A.3), we get:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[|εi​xi|​𝟏{|xi|≤C​vn}​|Δi​M|]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\varepsilon_{i}x_{i}|\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[εi4]14​𝔼i−1​[xi4​𝟏{|xi|≤C​vn}]14​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\varepsilon_{i}^{4}\right]^{\frac{1}{4}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[x_{i}^{4}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}|\leq Cv_{n}\}}\right]^{\frac{1}{4}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn34​Δn12​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{4}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
=mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn34​Δn12​1mn​Δn=Δn34​vnY/2−2≪ΔnY−14≪1,\displaystyle=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{4}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}=\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{4}}v_{n}^{Y/2-2}\ll\Delta_{n}^{\frac{Y-1}{4}}\ll 1,

since Δn1/2≪vn\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\ll v_{n} and Y>1Y>1.

Then we just need to focus on the last term involving xi2x_{i}^{2}. We need to show that

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[xi2​fn​(Δi​X)​Δi​M]=oP​(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[x_{i}^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (108)

Let’s start by replacing xix_{i} with bti−1​Δnb_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{n} in (108) with arbitrary MM. By the boundedness of KK, bb and Cauchy-Schwarz, we have

mn1/2​Δn2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[bti−12​fn​(Δi​X)​Δi​M]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[b_{t_{i-1}}^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]
≲mn1/2​Δn2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​mn​Δn​∑i=1n𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]1/2\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}m_{n}\Delta_{n}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{1/2}
≲mn1/2​Δn3/2vn2−Y/2​mn​Δn​(∑i=1n𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2])1/2\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{3/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}m_{n}\Delta_{n}}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]\Big)^{1/2}
≲Δn1/2vn2−Y/2​Δn−1/2​vnY/2→0\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{Y/2}}\rightarrow 0 (109)

which the last line follows from mn≫Δn−1​vnγm_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{-1}v_{n}^{\gamma} with γ<Y\gamma<Y and vn≫Δn1/2v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{1/2}. Besides, recall that x^i=σti−1​Δi​W+χti−1​Δi​J\hat{x}_{i}=\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W+\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J and by applying Cauchy-Schwarz twice and boundness of KK, we obtain

mn1/2​ΔnΔn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[bti−1​x^i​fn​(Δi​X)​Δi​M]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[b_{t_{i-1}}\hat{x}_{i}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]
≲mn1/2​ΔnΔn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​mn​Δn​(∑i=1n𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2])1/2​(∑i=1n𝔼i−1​[x^i2​fn2​(Δi​X)])1/2\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}m_{n}\Delta_{n}}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]\Big)^{1/2}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\hat{x}_{i}^{2}f_{n}^{2}(\Delta_{i}X)\right]\Big)^{1/2}
≲Δn1/2vn2−Y/2​mn1/2≲Δn1/2vn2−Y/2​Δn−1/2​vnY/2→0,\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}m_{n}^{1/2}}\lesssim\frac{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{Y/2}}\rightarrow 0, (110)

where the last line follows from mn≫Δn−1​vnγm_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{-1}v_{n}^{\gamma} with γ<Y\gamma<Y and vn≫Δn1/2v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{1/2}.

Now we just need to work on the case that xi=x^i=σti−1​Δi​W+Δi​Jx_{i}=\hat{x}_{i}=\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W+\Delta_{i}J. We first prove this for M=WM=W. Replacing xix_{i} with σti−1​Δi​W\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W in (108), for any q,p>1q,p>1 such that 1q+1p=1\frac{1}{q}+\frac{1}{p}=1, we obtain:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​|∑i=1nσti−12​Kmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​W)2​fn​(Δi​X)​Δi​M]|\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left|\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sigma_{t_{i-1}}^{2}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]\right|
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[|Δi​W|3​𝟏{|Δi​X|>vn}]\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{3}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}X|>v_{n}\}}\right]
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​W)3​p]1p​Pi−1​[|Δi​X|>vn]1q\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{3p}\right]^{\frac{1}{p}}P_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}X|>v_{n}\right]^{\frac{1}{q}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn−1​Δn32​(Δn​vn−Y)1q,\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{-1}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{2}}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{\frac{1}{q}}, (111)

where we used Lemma 2 in [4] and Hölder’s inequality in the third line. Notice that

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn1/2​(Δn​vn−Y)1q≪vn−2+Y/2​(Δn​vn−Y)1q.\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{\frac{1}{q}}\ll v_{n}^{-2+Y/2}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{\frac{1}{q}}.

Moreover, since 34+Y>12\frac{3}{4+Y}>\frac{1}{2}, we have

Δn3/2​vn−4+Y2≪1⇔Δn3/(4+Y)≪vn.\Delta_{n}^{3/2}v_{n}^{-\frac{4+Y}{2}}\ll 1\quad\Leftrightarrow\quad\Delta_{n}^{3/(4+Y)}\ll v_{n}.

Then (A.3) vanishes by taking qq close to 1.

Now, replacing xix_{i} with χti−1​Δi​J\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J with M=WM=W, we need to show that:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​fn​(Δi​X)​|Δi​W|]=oP​(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)|\Delta_{i}W|\right]=o_{P}(1). (112)

When |Δi​W|>vn|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n} or |εi|>vn|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}, recall (107) that P​(|εi|>vn)P(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}) and P​(|Δi​W|>vn)P(|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}) both decay faster than any power of Δn\Delta_{n}. By Hölder’s inequality, we can derive:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​fn​(Δi​X)​|Δi​W|​(𝟏{|Δi​W|>vn}+𝟏{|εi|>vn})]=oP​(1).\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)|\Delta_{i}W|(\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}\}}+\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}\}})\right]=o_{P}(1).

Thus, when |Δi​W|≤vn|\Delta_{i}W|\leq v_{n}, |εi|≤vn|\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}, and |Δi​X|=|xi+εi|≤ζ​vn|\Delta_{i}X|=|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq\zeta v_{n}, we have |Δi​J|≤C​vn|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n} for some constant CC. Therefore, for (112) to hold, it suffices to show that:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​𝟏{|Δi​J|≤C​vn}​|Δi​W|]​→𝑃​0.\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}W|\right]\overset{P}{\to}0.

Using Hölder’s inequality and Lemma 17 in [3], for any p,q>1p,q>1 such that 1p+1q=1\frac{1}{p}+\frac{1}{q}=1, we have:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​p​𝟏{|Δi​J|≤2​vn}]1p​𝔼i−1​[|Δi​W|q]1q\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2p}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq 2v_{n}\}}\right]^{\frac{1}{p}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{q}\right]^{\frac{1}{q}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​(Δn​vn2​p−Y)1p​Δn1/2.\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}.

Thus, by taking pp very close to 1 (and qq very large), we get convergence to 0 since

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​(Δn​vn2−Y)​Δn1/2≲vnY/2−2​vn2−Y​Δn1/2→0,\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2-Y}\right)\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\lesssim v_{n}^{Y/2-2}v_{n}^{2-Y}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\rightarrow 0,

which is due to Δn1/Y≪Δn1/2≪vn\Delta_{n}^{1/Y}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\ \ll v_{n}.

Now, we prove (108) for any bounded martingale MM orthogonal to WW. The cross-product term when expanding xi2x_{i}^{2} can be analyzed similarly by assuming |Δi​J|≤C​vn|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}. To this end, we need to show that:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[|Δi​J|​|Δi​W|​𝟏{|Δi​J|≤C​vn}​|Δi​M|]=oP​(1).\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}J||\Delta_{i}W|\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1).

Using Hölder’s inequality and (A.3), for any p,q>2p,q>2 such that 1/p+1/q=1/21/p+1/q=1/2 we conclude that:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[|Δi​J|​|Δi​W|​𝟏{|Δi​J|≤C​vn}​|Δi​M|]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}J||\Delta_{i}W|\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]
≤\displaystyle\leq mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)p​𝟏{|Δi​J|≤C​vn}]1p​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​W)q]1q​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2]12\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{{p}}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}\right]^{\frac{1}{p}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{{q}}\right]^{\frac{1}{{q}}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲\displaystyle\lesssim mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(Δn​vnp−Y)1/p​Δn1/2​1mn​Δn=(Δn​vnp−Y)1/pvn2−Y/2,\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{p-Y})^{1/p}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}=\frac{(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{p-Y})^{1/p}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}, (113)

which vanishes by taking pp close to 2 since

(Δn​vn2−Y)1/2vn2−Y/2=Δn1/2​vn−1≪Δn1/2−β≪1.\frac{(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2-Y})^{1/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}=\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{-1}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/2-\beta}\ll 1.

Next we consider the case when xix_{i} is replaced with σti−1​Δi​W\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W. Since fn​(x)≤𝟏|Δi​X|≥vnf_{n}(x)\leq\mathbf{1}_{|\Delta_{i}X|\geq v_{n}}, it suffices to show

Dn:=mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​σti−1​𝔼i−1​[|Δi​W|2​𝟏{|Δi​J|≤C​vn}​|Δi​M|]=oP​(1).D_{n}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1).

Notice that |Δi​X|=|xi+εi|≥vn|\Delta_{i}X|=|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\geq v_{n} implies that either |Δi​W|>vn/3|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}/3, |εi|>vn/3|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}/3 or |Δi​J|>vn/3|{\Delta_{i}J}|>v_{n}/3. The first two cases are straightforward as the tails decay faster than any power of Δn\Delta_{n}. For the remaining case we utilize Hölder’s inequality. For any p>0p>0, q>0q>0 such that 1/p+1/q=1/21/p+1/q=1/2, we obtain

Dn\displaystyle D_{n} ≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​σti−1​𝔼i−1​[|Δi​W|2​p]1/p\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{2p}\right]^{1/p}
×ℙi−1​[|Δi​J|>vn/3]1/q​𝔼i−1​[|Δi​M|2]1/2\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{P}_{i-1}\left[{|\Delta_{i}J|>v_{n}/3}\right]^{1/q}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\right]^{1/2}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn​(Δn​vn−Y)1/q​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[|Δi​M|2]1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{1/q}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\right]^{1/2}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn​(Δn​vn−Y)1/q​1mn​Δn=1Δn1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn​(Δn​vn−Y)1/q,\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{1/q}\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}=\frac{1}{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{1/q},

where we used (A.3). Using vn≫Δnβv_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} and taking qq close to 2 from above, the above equation vanishes since

1Δn1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn​(Δn​vn−Y)1/2=Δn​vn−2≪1.\frac{1}{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{1/2}=\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-2}\ll 1.

Finally, we consider the case where xix_{i} is replaced with χti−1​Δi​J\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J in (108). It requires to show:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​fn​(Δi​X)​Δi​M]=oP​(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (114)

Note that

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​|fn​(Δi​X)−fn​(χti−1​Δi​J)|​|Δi​M|]=oP​(1),\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\left|f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)-f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\right||\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1), (115)

which is shown at the end of the appendix. Hence it suffices to prove:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​fn​(χti−1​Δi​J)​Δi​M]=oP​(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (116)

In what follows, we assume χ=1\chi=1; the general case follows from analogous arguments. Hereafter, we assume that the following Lévy–Itô decomposition for J{J}:

Jt=∫0t∫x​𝟏{|x|≤1}​N¯​(d​s,d​x)+∫0t∫x​𝟏{|x|>1}​N​(d​s,d​x),J_{t}={\int_{0}^{t}\int{x\mathbf{1}_{\{|x|\leq 1\}}}\bar{N}(ds,dx)+\int_{0}^{t}\int{x\mathbf{1}_{\{|x|>1\}}}N(ds,dx)},

where N¯​(d​s,d​x)=N​(d​s,d​x)−ν​(d​x)​d​s\bar{N}(ds,dx)=N(ds,dx)-\nu(dx)ds is the compensated jump measure of JJ. Additionally, similar to expression (80) in [1], MM admits the decomposition:

Mt=Mt′+∫0t∫δ​(s,x)​N¯​(d​s,d​x),M_{t}=M^{\prime}_{t}+\int_{0}^{t}\int\delta(s,x)\bar{N}(ds,dx),

where M′M^{\prime} is a martingale orthogonal to both WW and NN, and δ\delta is a bounded function satisfying:

E[∫tu∫δ2(s,x)ν(dx)ds|ℱt]≤E[(Mu−Mt)2|ℱt]<∞.E\left[\int_{t}^{u}\int\delta^{2}(s,x)\nu(dx)ds\middle|\mathcal{F}_{t}\right]\leq E\left[(M_{u}-M_{t})^{2}\middle|\mathcal{F}_{t}\right]<\infty.

For future reference, define Ni​(d​s,d​x):=N​(ti+d​s,d​x)N^{i}(ds,dx):=N(t_{i}+ds,dx), δi​(s,x):=δ​(ti+s,x)\delta_{i}(s,x):=\delta(t_{i}+s,x), and:

pn​(x)=x2​fn​(x),tn​(y,x)=pn​(x+y)−pn​(y),wn​(y,x)=pn​(x+y)−pn​(y)−x​pn′​(y)​𝟏{|x|≤1}.p_{n}(x)=x^{2}f_{n}(x),\quad t_{n}(y,x)=p_{n}(x+y)-p_{n}(y),\quad w_{n}(y,x)=p_{n}(x+y)-p_{n}(y)-xp^{\prime}_{n}(y)\mathbf{1}_{\{|x|\leq 1\}}.

Applying Itô’s formula to Yui−1:=Lti−1+u−Lti−1Y_{u}^{i-1}:=L_{t_{i-1}+u}-L_{t_{i-1}}, we obtain:

pn​(Yui−1)=\displaystyle p_{n}(Y_{u}^{i-1})= ∫0upn′​(Ys−i−1)​𝑑Ysi−1+∫0u∫(pn​(Ys−i−1+x)−pn​(Ys−i−1)−pn′​(Ys−i−1)​x)​Ni−1​(d​s,d​x)\displaystyle\int_{0}^{u}p^{\prime}_{n}(Y_{s^{-}}^{i-1})dY_{s}^{i-1}+\int_{0}^{u}\int\left(p_{n}(Y_{s^{-}}^{i-1}+x)-p_{n}(Y_{s^{-}}^{i-1})-p^{\prime}_{n}(Y_{s-}^{i-1})x\right)N^{i-1}(ds,dx)
=\displaystyle= ∫0u∫|x|≤1pn′​(Ys−i−1)​x​N¯i−1​(d​s,d​x)+∫0u∫wn​(Ys−i−1,x)​Ni−1​(d​s,d​x).\displaystyle\int_{0}^{u}\int_{|x|\leq 1}p^{\prime}_{n}(Y_{s-}^{i-1})x\bar{N}^{i-1}(ds,dx)+\int_{0}^{u}\int w_{n}(Y_{s-}^{i-1},x)N^{i-1}(ds,dx). (117)

Now, let Zui−1:=Mti−1+u−Mti−1Z_{u}^{i-1}:=M_{t_{i-1}+u}-M_{t_{i-1}}. Applying Itô’s formula to pn​(Yui−1)​Zui−1p_{n}(Y_{u}^{i-1})Z_{u}^{i-1}, we get:

pn​(Yui−1)​Zui−1\displaystyle p_{n}(Y_{u}^{i-1})Z_{u}^{i-1} =∫0upn​(Ysi−1)​𝑑Zsi−1+∫0uZsi−1​d​(pn​(Ysi−1))+∑s≤uΔ​(pn​(Ysi−1))​Δ​Zsi−1\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{u}p_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1})dZ_{s}^{i-1}+\int_{0}^{u}Z_{s}^{i-1}d\left(p_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1})\right)+\sum_{s\leq u}\Delta(p_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1}))\Delta Z_{s}^{i-1}
=Mrtg+∫0u∫δi​(s,x)​tn​(Ysi−1,x)​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s+∫0u∫wn​(Ysi−1,x)​Zsi−1​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s,\displaystyle={\text{Mrtg}}+\int_{0}^{u}\int\delta_{i}(s,x)t_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1},x)\nu(dx)ds+\int_{0}^{u}\int w_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1},x)Z_{s}^{i-1}\nu(dx)ds, (118)

where Mrtg denotes the martingale part generated from the Itô’s formula. Fixing u=Δnu=\Delta_{n} in (A.3) and taking expectations, we obtain:

𝔼i−1​[pn​(Δi​J)​Δi​M]=\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[p_{n}(\Delta_{i}J)\Delta_{i}M\right]= 𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫δi​(s,x)​tn​(Ys,x)​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int\delta_{i}(s,x)t_{n}(Y_{s},x)\nu(dx)ds\right]
+𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫wn​(Ys,x)​Zs​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s].\displaystyle+\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int w_{n}(Y_{s},x)Z_{s}\nu(dx)ds\right]. (119)

In the above equation, we omit the superscript i−1i-1 in YY and ZZ for simplicity. For the second term in (A.3), we use the following bound (see (D.22) and (D.23) in [4]):

𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|wn​(Ys,x)|​|Zs|​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]≤K​(vn2−Y​(1+η)∨vn)​Δn​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|)+K​vn2−Y​(1+η)​Δn2​vnη−Y.\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|w_{n}(Y_{s},x)||Z_{s}|\nu(dx)ds\right]\leq K(v_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\vee v_{n})\Delta_{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|)+Kv_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{\eta-Y}.

Combining the above equation with the second term in (A.3) and plugging it back in (116), we need to show the negligibility of the two terms below:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(vn2−Y​(1+η)∨vn)​Δn​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(v_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\vee v_{n}\right)\Delta_{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|)
+mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​vn2−Y​(1+η)​Δn2​vnη−Y​Δn−1.\displaystyle\quad+\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{\eta-Y}\Delta_{n}^{-1}. (120)

The first term converges to 0 since vnY/2−2​vn2−Y​(1+η)​Δn1/2≪1v_{n}^{Y/2-2}v_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\ll 1 and vnY/2−2​vn​Δn1/2≪1v_{n}^{Y/2-2}v_{n}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\ll 1 with Y>1Y>1 if η\eta is small enough and

Δn1/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|)\displaystyle\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|)
≤(Δn​∑i=1nKmn​Δn2​(ti−1−τ))1/2​(∑i=1n𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|2))1/2=OP​(mn−1/2​Δn−1/2).\displaystyle\leq\Big(\Delta_{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K^{2}_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\Big)^{1/2}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2})\Big)^{1/2}=O_{P}(m_{n}^{-1/2}\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}).

The second term in (120) if of order mn1/2​vn−3​Y/2+(1−Y)​η​Δn3/2m_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{-3Y/2+(1-Y)\eta}\Delta_{n}^{3/2}, which vanishes by taking η\eta small enough due to the condition mn≪Δn−5​vn8+Ym_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{-5}v_{n}^{8+Y}, since Δn−5​vn8+Y≪vn3​Y​Δn−3\Delta_{n}^{-5}v_{n}^{8+Y}\ll v_{n}^{3Y}\Delta_{n}^{-3} with vn≪Δn1/(4−Y)v_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/(4-Y)}. Thus, the two terms in (120) converge to zero, and we conclude that:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(∫0Δn∫|wn​(Ys,x)|​|Zs|​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s)=oP​(1).\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|w_{n}(Y_{s},x)||Z_{s}|\nu(dx)ds\right)=o_{P}(1).

It remains to show that the contribution of the first term in (A.3) is negligible:

Fn:=mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫δi−1​(s,x)​tn​(Ys,x)​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]=oP​(1).F_{n}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int\delta_{i-1}(s,x)t_{n}(Y_{s},x)\nu(dx)ds\right]=o_{P}(1).

As in (D.25) in [4], we separately consider the cases where |Ys|≤vn|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}, |Ys|>ζ​vn|Y_{s}|>\zeta v_{n}, vn​(1+vnη)<|Ys|<ζ​vn​(1−vnη)v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta}), vn≤|Ys|≤vn​(1+vnη)v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta}), and ζ​vn≤|Ys|≤ζ​vn​(1+vnη)\zeta v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq\zeta v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta}).

First, suppose that |Ys|≤vn|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}, so that fn​(Ys)=0f_{n}(Y_{s})=0, and thus tn​(Ys,x)=(Ys+x)2​fn​(Ys+x)t_{n}(Y_{s},x)=(Y_{s}+x)^{2}f_{n}(Y_{s}+x), with |x|≥13​vn1+η|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta} (otherwise fn​(Ys+x)=0f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)=0). Notice that |tn​(Ys,x)|≤Ys2+2​|x​Ys|+x2|t_{n}(Y_{s},x)|\leq Y_{s}^{2}+2|xY_{s}|+x^{2}. For Ys2Y_{s}^{2}, using Cauchy-Schwarz and the bound

𝔼i−1​[Ys2​k​1{|Ys|≤vn}]≤K​Δn​vn2​k−Y,\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[Y_{s}^{2k}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}\right]\leq K\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2k-Y}, (121)

valid for all 0<s<Δn0<s<\Delta_{n} (see Lemma 12 in [4]),

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|​Ys2​1{|Ys|≤vn}​1{|x|≥13​vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|Y_{s}^{2}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right)
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(∫0Δn∫Ys4​1{|Ys|≤vn}​1{|x|≥13​vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s)12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int Y_{s}^{4}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
×𝔼i−1​(∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s)12\displaystyle\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(vn−Y​(1+η)​Δn2​vn4−Y)1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}(v_{n}^{-Y(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{4-Y})^{1/2}
×∑i=1nKmn​Δn(ti−1−τ)𝔼i−1(∫ti−1ti∫|δ(u,x)|2ν(dx)du)12\displaystyle\qquad\times\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int|\delta(u,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)du\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2​Δn3/2​vn−Y​(1+η)/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​((Δi​M)2)12\displaystyle\lesssim m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{3/2}v_{n}^{-Y(1+\eta)/2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left((\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲Δn1/2​vn−Y​(1+η)/2,\displaystyle\lesssim\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{-Y(1+\eta)/2}, (122)

where the last line follows from ∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​((Δi​M)2)12=OP​(mn−1/2​Δn−1)\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left((\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}=O_{P}(m_{n}^{-1/2}\Delta_{n}^{-1}) (see (A.3)) and Δn​mn≪1\Delta_{n}m_{n}\ll 1. The bound (122) tends to zero under our assumption vn≫Δnβv_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} with small enough η\eta. Next, we focus on 2​Ys​x2Y_{s}x. Using again (121) and Cauchy-Schwarz,

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|​|Ys​x|​1{|Ys|≤vn}​1{|x|≥13​vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)||Y_{s}x|1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s)12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
×𝔼i−1​(∫0Δn∫Ys2​x2​1{|Ys|≤vn}​1{|x|≥13​vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s)12\displaystyle\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int Y_{s}^{2}x^{2}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(Δn2​vn2−Y)12​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫ti−1ti∫|δ​(u,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑u]12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{2-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int|\delta(u,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)du\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
=mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn​Δn​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​(𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2])12=Δn12​vn−1​OP​(1),\displaystyle=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}}\Delta_{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}=\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}v_{n}^{-1}O_{P}(1), (123)

which again is oP​(1)o_{P}(1) since vn≫Δn12v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}.

It remains to analyze the term corresponding to x2x^{2}. First, since |Ys+x|≤ζ​vn|Y_{s}+x|\leq\zeta v_{n} when fn​(Ys+x)>0f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)>0, we have |x|≤(1+ζ)vn=:Cvn|x|\leq(1+\zeta)v_{n}=:Cv_{n} due to our assumption |Ys|≤vn|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}. Then, for any sequence αn>0\alpha_{n}>0 such that αn→0\alpha_{n}\to 0,

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|≤αn|δi−1​(s,x)|​x2​1{|x|≤C​vn}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|x^{2}1_{\{|x|\leq Cv_{n}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|x|≤C​vnx4​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|x|\leq Cv_{n}}x^{4}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
×𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|≤αn|δi−1​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(Δn​vn4−Y)12​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫ti−1ti∫|δ​(s,x)|≤αn|δ​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{4-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{1/2}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(Δn​vn4−Y)12​[∑i=1nKmn​Δn2​(ti−1−τ)]1/2​[∑i=1n𝔼i−1​[∫ti−1ti∫|δ​(s,x)|≤αn|δ​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]]1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{4-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\Big[\sum_{i=1}^{n}K^{2}_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\Big]^{1/2}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\Big[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\Big]\right]^{1/2}
≲mn1/2​Δn​[mn−1​Δn−2]1/2​[∑i=1n𝔼i−1​[∫ti−1ti∫|δ​(s,x)|≤αn|δ​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]]1/2=oP​(1),\displaystyle\lesssim m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}[m_{n}^{-1}\Delta_{n}^{-2}]^{1/2}{\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\Big[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\Big]\right]^{1/2}}=o_{P}(1), (124)

since as αn→0\alpha_{n}\to 0,

𝔼​[∑i=1n𝔼i−1​(∫ti−1ti∫|δ​(s,x)|≤αn|δ​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s)]=𝔼​[∫0T∫|δ​(s,x)|≤αn|δ​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]→0.\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right)\right]=\mathbb{E}\left[\int_{0}^{T}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]\to 0.

On the complementary region, we proceed as follows:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|>αn|δi−1​(s,x)|​x2​1{|x|≤C​vn}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|>\alpha_{n}}|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|x^{2}1_{\{|x|\leq Cv_{n}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≤Cαn​mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​vn2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|>αn|δi−1​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\leq\frac{C}{\alpha_{n}}\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|>\alpha_{n}}|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≤Cαn​mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​vn2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫ti−1ti∫|δ​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\leq\frac{C}{\alpha_{n}}\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≲Cαn​mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​vn2​1mn​Δn=vnY2αn​mn1/2​Δn1/2,\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{C}{\alpha_{n}}\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\frac{1}{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}=\frac{v_{n}^{\frac{Y}{2}}}{\alpha_{n}m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}, (125)

which is oP​(1)o_{P}(1) under our assumption mn​Δn≫vnγm_{n}\Delta_{n}\gg v_{n}^{\gamma} with γ<Y\gamma<Y, since vnY2αn​mn1/2​Δn1/2≪vnY−γ2αn\frac{v_{n}^{\frac{Y}{2}}}{\alpha_{n}m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}\ll\frac{v_{n}^{\frac{Y-\gamma}{2}}}{\alpha_{n}} and we can take αn→0\alpha_{n}\to 0 such that vn(Y−γ)/2αn→0\frac{v_{n}^{(Y-\gamma)/2}}{\alpha_{n}}\to 0. The proof for the negligibility of FnF_{n} in the case |Ys|≤vn|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n} is complete.

For the case of |Ys|≥ζ​vn|Y_{s}|\geq\zeta v_{n}, we have fn​(Ys)=0f_{n}(Y_{s})=0 and tn​(Ys,x)=(Ys+x)2​fn​(Ys+x)≤(ζ​vn)2t_{n}(Y_{s},x)=(Y_{s}+x)^{2}f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)\leq(\zeta v_{n})^{2}. We observe that when fn​(Ys+x)>0f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)>0, we have |Ys+x|≤ζ​vn​(1−13​vnη)|Y_{s}+x|\leq\zeta v_{n}(1-\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{\eta}), implying |x|>ζ​vn1+η/3|x|>\zeta v_{n}^{1+\eta}/3. We then can write that

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)
×𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|​(Ys+x)2​fn​(Ys+x)​1{|Ys|≥ζ​vn}​1{|x|≥C​vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|(Y_{s}+x)^{2}f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)1_{\{|Y_{s}|\geq\zeta v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​vn2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
×𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫1{|Ys|≥ζ​vn}​1{|x|≥C​vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int 1_{\{|Y_{s}|\geq\zeta v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​vn2​(Δn2​vn−Y−(1+η)​Y)12​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫ti−1ti∫|δ​(u,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑u]12≲(A.3)Δn12​vn−(1+η)​Y2,\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\left(\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{-Y-(1+\eta)Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int|\delta(u,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)du\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\eqref{kernel_sqrt_m}}}{{\lesssim}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}v_{n}^{-\frac{(1+\eta)Y}{2}},

which vanishes by taking small η>0\eta>0 due to vn≫Δnβv_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta}. We have then proved the negligibility of FnF_{n} in the case |Ys|≥ζ​vn|Y_{s}|\geq\zeta v_{n}.

For the case when vn​(1+vnη)<|Ys|<ζ​vn​(1−vnη)v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta}), when |x|≥13​vn1+η|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}, we can use the bound |tn​(Ys,x)|≤C​vn2|t_{n}(Y_{s},x)|\leq Cv_{n}^{2} and follow a similar proof as in (E.27). When |x|≤13​vn1+η|x|\leq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}, fn​(x+Ys)=1=f​(Ys)f_{n}(x+Y_{s})=1=f(Y_{s}), implying tn​(Ys,x)=x2+2​x​Yst_{n}(Y_{s},x)=x^{2}+2xY_{s}. We consider the contribution of each term separately below. For the case of x2x^{2}, we have:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)
×𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|​x2​1vn​(1+vnη)<|Ys|<ζ​vn​(1−vnη)​1{|x|≤C​vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|x^{2}1_{v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta})}1_{\{|x|\leq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)
×𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12​Ei−1​[∫0Δn∫x4​1{|Ys|≥vn}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}E_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int x^{4}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\geq v_{n}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(vn(4−Y)​(1+η)​Δn2​vn−Y)12​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​(Ei−1​[(Δi​M)2])12≲vnη​(4−Y)−Y2​Δn12≪1,\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(v_{n}^{(4-Y)(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(E_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}]\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\lesssim v_{n}^{\frac{\eta(4-Y)-Y}{2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}\ll 1,

for all η>0\eta>0, where the last line follows from (A.3). For the term corresponding to 2​|x​Ys|2|xY_{s}|, since |Ys|<ζ​vn​(1−vnη)|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta}), for some CC,

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)
×𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|​|x​Ys|​1vn​(1+vnη)<|Ys|<ζ​vn​(1−vnη)​1{|x|≤C​vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)||xY_{s}|1_{v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta})}1_{\{|x|\leq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
×𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫x2​Ys2​1{|Ys|≤ζ​vn}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int x^{2}Y_{s}^{2}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq\zeta v_{n}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​(vn(2−Y)​(1+η)​Δn2​vn2−Y)12​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​(𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2])12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(v_{n}^{(2-Y)(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{2-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}]\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
=vn−Y2+η​(2−Y)2​Δn12​OP​(1)=oP​(1),\displaystyle=v_{n}^{-\frac{Y}{2}+\frac{\eta(2-Y)}{2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}O_{P}(1)=o_{P}(1), (126)

where again the last line follows from (A.3) for all η>0\eta>0. This proves the negligibility of FnF_{n} for the case vn​(1+vnη)<|Ys|<ζ​vn​(1−vnη)v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta}).

The only cases left are when vn≤|Ys|≤vn​(1+vnη)v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta}) and ζ​vn≤|Ys|≤ζ​vn​(1+vnη)\zeta v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq\zeta v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta}). It suffices to consider the first case as the other case is proved similarly. If |x|≥vn1+η|x|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}, consider the same argument as in (D.26) in [4] and suppose that |x|≤vn1+η|x|\leq v_{n}^{1+\eta}. Note that |pn′​(y)|≤2​|y​fn​(y)|+|y2​fn′​(y)|≤C​vn1−η|p^{\prime}_{n}(y)|\leq 2|yf_{n}(y)|+|y^{2}f^{\prime}_{n}(y)|\leq Cv_{n}^{1-\eta} when |y|≤C​vn|y|\leq Cv_{n}. Consequently, |tn​(Ys,x)|≤|pn′​(Ys,x)|​|x|≤C​vn1−η​|x||t_{n}(Y_{s},x)|\leq|p^{\prime}_{n}(Y_{s},x)||x|\leq Cv_{n}^{1-\eta}|x|. Thus, FnF_{n} is bounded by

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn1−η​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|​|x|​1{vn≤|Ys|≤vn​(1+vnη)}​1{|x|≤vn1+η}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}}v_{n}^{1-\eta}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)||x|1_{\{v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\}}1_{\{|x|\leq v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn1−η​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|δi−1​(s,x)|2​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}}v_{n}^{1-\eta}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
×𝔼i−1​[∫0Δn∫|x|≤C​vn1+ηx2​1{vn≤|Ys|≤vn​(1+vnη)}​ν​(d​x)​𝑑s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|x|\leq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}}x^{2}1_{\{v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn1−η​(vn(2−Y)​(1+η)​Δn2​vnη−Y)12​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​(𝔼i−1​[(Δi​M)2])12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}}v_{n}^{1-\eta}\left(v_{n}^{(2-Y)(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{\eta-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}]\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
=vn−Y2+η​(1−Y)2​Δn12​OP​(1),\displaystyle=v_{n}^{-\frac{Y}{2}+\frac{\eta(1-Y)}{2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}O_{P}(1), (127)

where we used (D.24) in [4] and (A.3). By taking η\eta small enough, it follows that the above expression is oP​(1)o_{P}(1). This concludes the proof. ♢\diamondsuit

Proof of (115).

We start by noting that

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​𝟏|χti−1​Δi​J|>4​ζ​vn​|fn​(Δi​X)−fn​(χti−1​Δi​J)|​|Δi​M|]=oP​(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|>4\zeta v_{n}}\left|f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)-f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\right||\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1). (128)

Indeed, note that

𝟏|χti−1​Δi​J|>4​ζ​vn​|fn​(Δi​X)−fn​(χti−1​Δi​J)|\displaystyle\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|>4\zeta v_{n}}\left|f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)-f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\right| ≤𝟏|χti−1​Δi​J|>4​ζ​vn​fn​(Δi​X)≤𝟏|bti−1​Δn+σti−1​Δi​W+εi|>3​ζ​vn,\displaystyle\leq\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|>4\zeta v_{n}}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\leq\mathbf{1}_{|b_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{n}+\sigma_{t_{i-1}\Delta_{i}W}+\varepsilon_{i}|>3\zeta v_{n}}, (129)

and, thus, by Hölder’s and Markov’s inequalities along with vn≫Δnβv_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} and (57), for large enough rr, we have:

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​|Δi​M|​(𝟏|bti−1​Δn|>ζ​vn+𝟏|σti−1ΔiW|>ζvn+𝟏|εi|>ζ​vn)]=oP​(1),\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}|\Delta_{i}M|(\mathbf{1}_{|b_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{n}|>\zeta v_{n}}+\mathbf{1}_{|\sigma_{t_{i-1}\Delta_{i}W|>\zeta v_{n}}}+\mathbf{1}_{|\varepsilon_{i}|>\zeta v_{n}})\right]=o_{P}(1),

which implies (128) and (129). Consequently, it suffices to prove that

mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​𝟏|χti−1​Δi​J|≤4​ζ​vn​|fn​(Δi​X)−fn​(χti−1​Δi​J)|​|Δi​M|]=oP​(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|\leq 4\zeta v_{n}}\left|f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)-f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\right||\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1). (130)

First, we observe that

|fn​(x+y)−fn​(y)|≤𝟏|x|≥vn1+η/3+𝟏vn≤|y|≤(1+vnη)​ or ​ζ​vn​(1−vnη)≤|y|≤ζ​vn​|x|vn1+η,\displaystyle|f_{n}(x+y)-f_{n}(y)|\leq\mathbf{1}_{|x|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}/3}+\mathbf{1}_{v_{n}\leq|y|\leq(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\text{ or }\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta})\leq|y|\leq\zeta v_{n}}\frac{|x|}{v_{n}^{1+\eta}}, (131)

where y=χti−1​Δi​Jy=\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J and x=ΔiX−χti−1ΔiJ=bti−1Δn+σti−1ΔiW+εi=:zi,1+zi,2+zi,3x=\Delta_{i}X-\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J=b_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{n}+\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W+\varepsilon_{i}=:z_{i,1}+z_{i,2}+z_{i,3}.

We start with the first term in (131). We proceed to verify that

Bl:=mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​𝟏|χti−1​Δi​J|≤4​ζ​vn​𝟏|zi,l|≥vn1+η/9​|Δi​M|]=oP​(1),B_{l}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|\leq 4\zeta v_{n}}\mathbf{1}_{|z_{i,l}|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}/9}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1),

for l=1,2,3l=1,2,3. Take the case l=2l=2 for instance. Assuming χ=σ=1\chi=\sigma=1 for simplicity, by Holder’s inequality we obtain

B2≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(Δi​J8​𝟏|Δi​J|≤4​ζ​vn)1/4​Pi−1​(|Δi​W|≥vn1+η/9)1/4​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|2)1/2.B_{2}\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(\Delta_{i}J^{8}\mathbf{1}_{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq 4\zeta v_{n}}\big)^{1/4}P_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}W|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}/9\big)^{1/4}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\big)^{1/2}.

Notice that for any α>0\alpha>0, for some constant CC, we have Pi−1​(|Δi​W|≥vn1+η/9)≲𝔼​(|Δi​W|α)/vnα​(1+η)≤Δnα/vnα​(1+η)P_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}W|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}/9)\lesssim\mathbb{E}(|\Delta_{i}W|^{\alpha})/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)}\leq\Delta^{\alpha}_{n}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)}. Therefore, along with Proposition 1 and (A.3), we have

B2\displaystyle B_{2} ≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn1/4​vn(8−Y)/4​Δnα/4/vnα​(1+η)/4​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|2)1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{1/4}v_{n}^{(8-Y)/4}\Delta^{\alpha/4}_{n}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)/4}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2})^{1/2}
≲mn1/2​vnY/4Δn1/4​vn2−Y/2​Δnα/4/vnα​(1+η)/4.\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{Y/4}}{\Delta_{n}^{1/4}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta^{\alpha/4}_{n}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)/4}.

Since vn≫Δnβv_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta}, for small enough η>0\eta>0, 12−β​(1+η)>0\frac{1}{2}-\beta(1+\eta)>0. Then by taking α\alpha large enough we obtain B2=oP​(1)B_{2}=o_{P}(1). B1B_{1} can be shown oP​(1)o_{P}(1) using the similar argument. For B3B_{3}, by (57)

B3\displaystyle B_{3} ≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(Δi​J8​𝟏|Δi​J|≤4​ζ​vn)1/4​𝔼​(|εi|4​α)1/4/vnα​(1+η)/4​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|2)1/2\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(\Delta_{i}J^{8}\mathbf{1}_{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq 4\zeta v_{n}}\big)^{1/4}\mathbb{E}\big(|\varepsilon_{i}|^{4\alpha}\big)^{1/4}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)/4}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\big)^{1/2}
≤mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2​Δn1/4​vn(8−Y)/4​Δn(1+α/2)/4/vnα​(1+η)/4​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|2)1/2,\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{1/4}v_{n}^{(8-Y)/4}\Delta^{(1+\alpha/2)/4}_{n}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)/4}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\big)^{1/2},

which tends to zero in probability by taking η\eta small enough and α\alpha large enough similar to B2B_{2}. Next, we analyze the second term in (131). We only consider {vn≤|y|≤vn​(1+vnη)}\{v_{n}\leq|y|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\} as the other case is similar. To this end, we need to show that

Cl:=mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2+1+η​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​[(Δi​J)2​𝟏vn≤|χti−1​Δi​J|≤vn​(1+vnη)​|Δi​M|​|zi,l|]=oP​(1),C_{l}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{v_{n}\leq|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})}|\Delta_{i}M||z_{i,l}|\right]=o_{P}(1),

for l=1,2,3l=1,2,3. Assume for simplicity of notation that χ=σ=1\chi=\sigma=1. By (A.3), Holder’s inequality and Lemma 17 in [3], for any p,q>1p,q>1 such that 1/p+1/q=1/21/p+1/q=1/2,

C2\displaystyle C_{2} ≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2+1+η​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​𝔼i−1​(Δi​J2​p​𝟏vn≤|Δi​J|≤vn​(1+vnη))1/p​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​W|q)1/q​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|2)1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(\Delta_{i}J^{2p}\mathbf{1}_{v_{n}\leq|\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})}\big)^{1/p}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}W|^{q}\big)^{1/q}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2})^{1/2}
≲mn1/2Δn−1/2​vn2−Y/2+1+η​∑i=1nKmn​Δn​(ti−1−τ)​(Δn​vn2​p−Y+η)1/p​Δn1/2​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​W|q)1/q​𝔼i−1​(|Δi​M|2)1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y+\eta})^{1/p}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}W|^{q}\big)^{1/q}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2})^{1/2}
≲(Δn​vn2​p−Y+η)1/pvn2−Y/2+1+η.\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y+\eta})^{1/p}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}.

Taking pp close to 22 such that 1/p=1/2−s1/p=1/2-s for some small s>0s>0, the last line has order

(Δn​vn2​p−Y+η)1/pvn2−Y/2+1+η=vn(Y−4)/2​Δn1/2−s​vn2−Y/2+η/2+s​(Y−η)=Δn1/2−s​vnη/2−1+s​(Y−η)≤Δn1/2−s​vnη/2−1,\frac{(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y+\eta})^{1/p}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}=v_{n}^{(Y-4)/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/2-s}v_{n}^{2-Y/2+\eta/2+s(Y-\eta)}=\Delta_{n}^{1/2-s}v_{n}^{\eta/2-1+s(Y-\eta)}\leq\Delta_{n}^{1/2-s}v_{n}^{\eta/2-1},

which vanishes since vn≫Δnβv_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} and Δn1/2−s−(1−η/2)​β≪1\Delta_{n}^{1/2-s-(1-\eta/2)\beta}\ll 1 given η\eta and ss are small enough. A similar argument works for C1C_{1} and C3C_{3} and establishes (115). ♢\diamondsuit
